reviews.text:
‚õ∞Ô∏èAn interesting Gallery inside a defunct monorail station showcasing Sentosa's geological formation of the many different types of sedimentary rocks and it's varied habitats.
‚õ∞Ô∏èOn display are samples of various flora, fauna and rock samples like the sandstone, siltstone, claystone, conglomerate, etc.
üåãThe Gallery is filled with well illustrated storyboard detailing earth process, rock formations and the diverse flora and fauna found around the Island and at it's Nature Trails at forested area and along coastal shores.
‚õ∞Ô∏èAn interesting learning experience.
A very underrated gallery that has very few visitors. Lots of interesting gallery details about the place. Worthwhile to visit.

Nature Discovery in Sentosa offers a refreshing escape into natural beauty. It provides a serene environment perfect for leisurely walks. It enhance the experience, educating visitors about local flora and fauna. It's a tranquil retreat ideal for families and nature enthusiasts.

Take Sentosa Express and alight at Imbiah Station. Followed Imbiah Lookout sign. Take the escalator up to Merlion Cable Car Station. From there turn left and climb up flights of staircases will see Madame Tussards Museum turn right is the Sentosa Cable Car Station and walk further up will see the entrance to Sentosa Nature Discovery. It is transformed from a former Sentosa monorail station. There are 8 different types of habitats for checking out. Geology Gallery showcases earth processes and rock formation, geological map, coastal forests, rock samples and fossils

Great use for an old monorail station. We used this trail to join up to Imbiah trail.
Not crowded and it costs nothing!
This part is flat and good for kids and elderly folk, there are no stairs to navigate. Needs a little upkeep to make it sparkle again.
